title: Ticket #5014: ssh-to-job hangs schedd?
description:
NOT confirmed to be a problem off my branch, however, see #4997.

condor_ssh_to_job can effectively hang the schedd if it fails to authenticate with Kerberos.

Condor_Auth_Kerberos::authenticate eventually calls 

condor_read (
    peer_description=0x233246c "<128.104.100.29:14489>", fd=16,
    buf=0x7fffd2609350 "\340Ny\035", sz=5, timeout=20, flags=0,
    non_blocking=false)

which ends up repeating 

04/22/15 16:08:41 (pid:4494) condor_read(): timeout reading 5 bytes from <128.10
4.100.29:14489>.
04/22/15 16:08:41 (pid:4494) IO: Failed to read packet header
04/22/15 16:09:01 (pid:4494) condor_read(): timeout reading 5 bytes from <128.10
4.100.29:14489>.
04/22/15 16:09:01 (pid:4494) IO: Failed to read packet header
04/22/15 16:09:21 (pid:4494) condor_read(): timeout reading 5 bytes from <128.10
4.100.29:14489>.
04/22/15 16:09:21 (pid:4494) IO: Failed to read packet header

in the log for a long time.

The client stalls for a long time at the following (D_ALL): 

04/22/15 16:13:32 (fd:4) (pid:26222) (D_ALWAYS:2) SharedPortClient: sent connection request to schedd submit-3.batlab.org for shared port id 10722_4af1_8
04/22/15 16:13:32 (fd:4) (pid:26222) (D_ALWAYS) KERBEROS: No credentials cache found

GDB reveals 

#0  0x00007ff2e91e8098 in poll () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007ff2ea042ed6 in Selector::execute (this=0x7fff25151ec0)
    at /home/tlmiller/condor/source/src/condor_utils/selector.cpp:314
#2  0x00007ff2ea19ebd8 in condor_read (
    peer_description=0x2481470 "schedd submit-3.batlab.org", fd=3,
    buf=0x7fff25152030 "(\261\031\352\362\177", sz=5, timeout=300, flags=0,
    non_blocking=false)
    at /home/tlmiller/condor/source/src/condor_io/condor_rw.cpp:191

below a call to 

#8  0x00007ff2ea1cb20e in Authentication::handshake (this=0x2486620,
    my_methods=..., non_blocking=false)
    at /home/tlmiller/condor/source/src/condor_io/authentication.cpp:1006
#9  0x00007ff2ea1c8c10 in Authentication::authenticate_continue (
    this=0x2486620, errstack=0x7fff25153600, non_blocking=false)
    at /home/tlmiller/condor/source/src/condor_io/authentication.cpp:206
#10 0x00007ff2ea1c896f in Authentication::authenticate_inner (this=0x2486620,
    hostAddr=0x24679b0 "<128.104.100.22:9150?addrs=[2607:f388:107c:501:1b:21ff:feca:51f0]:9150+128.104.100.22:9150&noUDP&rewrite=2607:f388:107c:501:1b:21ff:feca:51f0&sock=10722_4af1_8>", auth_methods=0x246a900 "FS,KERBEROS,GSI",
    errstack=0x7fff25153600, timeout=-1, non_blocking=false)
    at /home/tlmiller/condor/source/src/condor_io/authentication.cpp:162

Retesting with SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS = FS, CLAIMTOBE avoids the problem.

The condor_ssh_to_job call is from a different machine, so FS can't work.
remarks:
2015-Apr-22 16:41:50 by tlmiller:
Switching the client to FS, GSI changed the error message but didn't solve the problem.

Running 

_CONDOR_SEC_DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATION=R _CONDOR_TOOL_DEBUG=D_ALL condor_q -debug -name submit-3.batlab.org

reproduced the problem with condor_q.

2015-Apr-22 17:13:47 by tlmiller:
This appears to fail with the 8.3.5 binaries.

2015-Apr-22 17:34:03 by tlmiller:
Does not appear to happen with the BaTLab's 8.2.7 daemons in production.

2015-Apr-29 15:11:42 by bbockelm:
Was not able to reproduce with GSI auth on the CMS global pool.

2015-Apr-29 15:12:17 by tannenba:
Related at all to #4997 ?

2015-Apr-29 15:47:00 by tlmiller:
Zach was going to look into this, since it seems like a bug in the security code.

Apparently the description isn't clear: the bug only occurs if authentication fails (perhaps only if authentication can't succeed, e.g., no GSI or Kerberos authtokens). However, since this is very easy for an attacker to arrange...

2015-May-27 13:39:19 by tlmiller:
(No, it's unrelated to #4997.)
